overview.title: Overview
overview.content: This calculator allows you to compute square roots of various types of numbers: real, complex, arbitrary precision, and even symbolic expressions. It supports multiple languages and can be customized to your needs.

features.title: Features
features.content:
• Real number square roots
  • Complex number support (including roots of negative numbers)
  • Arbitrary precision calculations using the Decimal.js library
  • Symbolic/analytical computation for mathematical expressions
  • Multilingual interface with runtime language switching
  • No restart required for language changes

modes.title: Calculation Modes
modes.content:
Real Numbers — Standard square root for non-negative real numbers.

Complex Numbers — Handles negative numbers by returning complex results (e.g., √-4 = 2i).

Arbitrary Precision — Uses high-precision decimal arithmetic for accurate results with many decimal places.

Analytical — Processes symbolic expressions and returns simplified square root forms.

precision.title: Precision Control
precision.content: In Arbitrary Precision mode, you can specify the number of decimal places (0-50). This is useful for scientific calculations or when you need exact results beyond standard floating-point precision.

addingLanguage.title: Adding a New Language
addingLanguage.content:
To add a new language to the application at runtime:

Step 1: Click the + button next to the language selector in the header.

Step 2: Fill in the required fields:

  • Language Code — A short code (e.g., "fr" for French, "ja" for Japanese)
  • Language Name — The name in English (e.g., "French")
  • Native Name — The name in the language itself (e.g., "Français")

Step 3: Paste the JSON translation file. The JSON must include these sections:

  • app — Application title, navigation, footer
  • calculator — All calculator interface texts
  • documentation — Documentation page content
  • support — Support page content
  • common — Common UI elements
  • modal — Modal dialog texts

Important: The new language will be available immediately without restarting the application. Your language preference is saved in the browser.

items.question: How do I calculate the square root of a negative number?
items.answer: Switch to 'Complex Numbers' mode using the mode selector. The calculator will return the imaginary result (e.g., √-4 = 2i).

items.question: How can I increase calculation precision?
items.answer: Select 'Arbitrary Precision' mode and adjust the precision slider to your desired number of decimal places (up to 50).

items.question: Can I add a new language?
items.answer: Yes! Use the 'Add Language' feature in the language selector. You can add custom translations at runtime without restarting the application.

items.question: What is analytical mode?
items.answer: Analytical mode processes symbolic mathematical expressions and returns simplified forms. For example, √(x²) returns |x|.
